info.name: Postcentral gyrus
info.description: The postcentral gyrus is the vertically-oriented gyrus of the cerebral hemisphere located immediately posterior to the central sulcus. Functionally, it serves as the primary somatic sensory cortex. The body and head are represented somatotopically within the gyrus such that the head is located laterally near the lateral sulcus and the feet are located most medially in the longitudinal fissure. In Brodmann's designation, this gyrus is termed Areas 3,1,2.
